Ukraine's fight against corruption remains fragile
subhead: In July, a law stripping two anti-corruption agencies of their independence sparked an outcry, forcing President Volodymyr Zelensky to backtrack. Two months later, while the agencies' autonomy was officially restored, their staff have criticized the government for a lack of support.

title: Sébastien Lecornu, a prime minister in no hurry to form his government
Syria's new president stresses diplomacy but warns against Israel in UN debut
UN demands probe after drone 'attack' on Gaza aid flotilla
subhead: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights called for an end to the 'attacks' on the flotilla bound for the Gaza Strip, demanding an 'independent' investigation. Meanwhile, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez said Madrid would dispatch a navy ship on Thursday, 'to ensure that, if necessary, our citizens can be rescued."

title: Why Israel faces no sanctions from international sports bodies, unlike Russia
subhead: Teams, clubs, and athletes from Israel continue to participate in various international competitions, despite mounting calls for their exclusion. Independent United Nations (UN) experts on Tuesday urged FIFA and UEFA to impose sanctions.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Gucci stages Demna's debut
subhead: A palazzo transformed into a movie theater, a short film, and a parade of celebrities: The Florentine fashion house masterfully orchestrated the arrival of its new artistic director on the opening day of the Spring-Summer 2026 women's collections.

title: BYD Vice President Stella Li says Chinese automaker is in Europe for the 'long term'
subhead: The Chinese car group has demonstrated its ambitions at the Lyon Auto Show, which runs from September 24 to 28. Le Monde spoke with Stella Li, who jointly manages the company with her husband, Wang Chuanfu.

Italy's 'anti-vax' movement is galvanized by Kennedy Jr
subhead: Ever since Robert F. Kennedy Jr was appointed as US health secretary, the scientific community has feared that skepticism of vaccines could spread to the rest of the world. In Italy, his influence has already become apparent.

title: In Italy, tens of thousands hold protests in solidarity with Gaza
subhead: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets across Italy on Monday to 'condemn the genocide in Gaza,' during a day of protests marked by strikes and blockades organized by several unions, echoing the slogan of the French protest movement, Block Everything.

title: Dan Ben-David, economist: 'Israel has broken the roots of its growth'
subhead: The professor at Tel Aviv University warns that years of underinvestment, especially in education, and the rising influence of religious Jews are pushing Israel toward an existential crisis.
